meanings.definition: Giving good value or service in relation to the amount of money, time, or resources spent.
meanings.sent1: The store offered an economical solution for our budget.
meanings.sent2: She always looks for the most economical option when shopping.
meanings.sent3: It was quite economical to buy the giant teddy bear on sale.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an economical way to brighten up the room.
meanings.sent5: The economical car saved them a lot of money on gas.

meanings.definition: Using the minimum amount of money, time, or resources necessary.
meanings.sent1: He found an economical way to fix the leaky faucet.
meanings.sent2: The company adopted an economical approach to reduce waste.
meanings.sent3: It was quite economical to use a paperclip as a bookmark.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was an economical remedy for a bad day.
meanings.sent5: The economical use of ingredients made the dish delicious and affordable.
